Who are the Recycling Raccoons? We are a team of students from the Massachusetts Academy of Math and Science in Worcester, Massachusetts who strive to help our community through the creation of this app. As concerns for the environment grow, proper recycling becomes increasingly important. In our research, we found that people that do not recycle do so due to a lack of access or because they find recycling tedious or confusing. Hearing this, we decided that it would be helpful to simplify the most confusing part of the process—determining recyclability or reusing recyclable items. With the guide of this app, everyone becomes capable of helping to save the environment. What is Mass Academy? The Massachusetts Academy of Math and Science (MAMS) is a public school in Worcester, Massachusetts that offers STEM-focused (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) courses at an advanced level for 11th and 12th graders. The school puts an emphasis on project-based learning and collaboration. Students also pursue long-term projects such as a 5-month independent research project, a 3-month assistive device group project, and a 2-month Apps for Good group project. This app is the work of one Apps for Good project that provides the community with assistance during the recycling process.
What is Apps for Good? Apps for Good is an organization that brings education and access to students interested in coding all over the world. The learning experience is student-driven as small groups of students work together to learn and create their own app which makes a difference in their community.
